Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2012 10:13AM kona14 wrote: Curveball, I see that our diagnosis and treatments are quite similar.  I also had only one positive lymph node and a very small tumor.  I will start chemo in two weeks; however, did your onc tell you or give you any reason for the node being positive with such a small tumor?  I am pissed off but also very humbled with only one nodal involvement.  I am a previous Hodgkin's survivor and cannot have adriamycin (I had my lifetime supply of it 22 yrs. ago.) I have never had cytoxan or taxoter--are they bad?  See my onc on Aug. 6 to start chemo regime.  Thanks for any help!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2012 teeballmom SusanHG123

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2012 06:02PM kona14 wrote: Tazzy or anyone who has finished chemo, I had my 4th chemo last Wednesday and it seems to be knocking me down harder this time.  My last round is Dec. 5.  How many weeks does it take to start feeling better after your last round?  My DH and I are going to Vegas at the end of January and I truly want to feel better!  Thanks for any advice.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2012 06:25AM kona14 wrote: As Diane states in her article, all woman diagnosed with breast cancer will have to live with the fear of reoccurrence.  I had Hodgkin's Disease back in 1989 and lived with the fear of reoccurrence for 22 years.  I know how it feels to always have that in the back of your mind, but I always looked at it as what is meant to happen will happen.  I believe that we have to go on living life to its fullest and entertain, challenge, and fulfill ourselves both mentally and physically and even spiritually.  Why I was in remission for 22 years and then suddenly got breast cancer from my 27 radiation treatments back in 1989--I don't know and I will never know.  However, I believe there is a reason for everything, and just like back then, I know that I am meant to still be here for a while and just have to find that direction I am supposed to be heading down now.  Don't look behind you for cancer to catch you, but rather look forward to the rest of your life!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2012 05:28AM kona14 wrote: Melmcbee- I know how you feel about looking in the mirror and saying "WTF!"  My son and I were talking and he said that I am going to look "weird" when my hair starts growing back.  That's how used to my bald head he's gotten.  Pretty messed up!  I too have gained weight.  I went on weight watchers and followed it strictly for a week.  Then, I had chemo #4 a week ago and could barely eat for three days.  When I got back on the scale this past weekend, I thought for sure that I would have lost weight--at least a pound!  But NOOOOOOOOOO, I stayed the exact same weight!  I truly believe that chemo massively slows down your metabolism.  I don't care what the oncs say, but something with the decadron and chemo makes us gain.  Anyone else getting "buff" without really working out?  I used to do Tae Bo with resistance bands and was somewhat toned before all of this.  My arms should be flabby by now, but I still have a lot of muscle.  Not complaining, but I look like a jock with my bald head and arms!  Kinda unfeminine!  My DH jokes that I can kick his arse!!!!!! Ha! Ha!  Oh, well.  I keep looking for the finish line and new foobies.  Hopefully I will have them by summer and I can walk around bra-less with firm ones and just smile that this is now finally and hopefully behind me! Going to see my cardiologist on Monday and hoping my recent echo cardiogram turned out okay.  I get a lot of palpitations, probably b'c I have mitral valve prolapse.  Hoping the ticker is still going strong.  Good luck to everyone this week, and like melmcbee, cherish the good days!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2012 05:08PM kona14 wrote: Hi everyone.  I am usually a very positive person, but I had an extreme tragedy happen yesterday.  My German shepherds broke through our invisible fencing yesterday morning, probably chasing a deer.  I live on 20 acres and it is hunting season now.  They have been missing since early yesterday morning.  Posted it on face book and NO ONE has seen them.  My husband heard gun shots when he was going to work shortly after I let them out yesterday.  All we can think is that a hunter shot them. It is so unlike them to ever roam off.  My heart has been ripped out of my chest.  Now all I can think about is WTF--who needs the last round of chemo I'm due for.  What does it all really matter?  My closest buddies are gone.  Now I am alone without them to fight this f$%^ cancer.  I so emotionally distraught.  I just can't take all of this trauma any longer.  My husband is worried about me because he knows how badly this hurts.  I keep trying to think that there had to be a reason for this, but I can't justify any!  What kind of human being would ever do this?  So sorry to unload.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2013 01:04PM kona14 wrote: It's the 5th.  Wow chemo brain! Thanks melmcbee!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2013 04:15AM kona14 wrote: Hi girls.  Surgery lasted about 2 hours.  My PS said to my DH after surgery that they look great.  I looked at them yesterday and I am liking what I see!  He put in Mentor smooth high profile gel.  I think that they are 700-800.  I will check this when I go for my check up.  Pain is not bad.  I walk like a stiff board again (like after MX).  I am just taking Tylenol now and doing fine.  Only time I am uncomfortable is when I get cold--shivering hurts my pecs. It looks like I will have nice cleavage, although the right seems a bit flatter than the left.  All in all, do not fear!  This surgery is not bad at all!  Hope everyone is doing well.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 03:59AM kona14 wrote: I've read that inflammation can cause a host of health issues, including cancer.  Very little salt intake sure helps with this.  After watching a documentary about vegan-ism and seeing how they slaughter cows and pigs not to mention how chickens are treated, I decided to go vegetarian.  I live in the Midwest and was born and raised on meat.  My son and I went to Chile's and I could not believe that every single menu item has meat in it except for a house salad or a Caribbean salad (which was very good).  I felt like an alien watching everyone else eat meat, including my son.  I don't think that I will ever be the same after watching how animals are prepared for our consumption.  What took me so damn long to realize this and how bad meat is for our bodies?  I feel like I have been taken over by the health police, but I have this super strong drive to stay as healthy as possible now that I can see the light at the end of the tunnel.  The thought of a recurrence scares the crap out of me and I guess I am going to do everything I can to stay healthy and keep my immune system pumped.  Bought a juicer yesterday.  My frig looks like a vegetable garden.  My DH looked in the frig and said his mom would fall over and say, "What the hell am I supposed to eat?"   No more meatloaf and mashed potatoes for us!  I am making my first batches of juice this morning.  Hopefully they taste good and not like barium!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2013 07:18AM kona14 wrote: Beckers--I started juicing yesterday.  I made a juice with kale, cucumber, celery, spinach, parsley, and an apple.  It's weird to drink your vegetables, but after the first few sips, I put it in my head that this is super good for me. About 1/2 hour after I drank it, I could feel my stomach full with fiber from the veggies.  I don't know if it was psychological or what, but I had a lot of energy afterwards.  Later in the day I made a juice with strawberries, blueberries, and an apple and it was delicious!  I bought the Omega large mouth juicer at Kohl's.  With a 20% off coupon, I paid $213 including tax.  Seems like a lot of $, but it is a very good juicer.  I rather pay $200 for a juicer and not for a doctor (hopefully)!  I did crave carbs and sweets yesterday.  I think my body is withdrawing from them and craved them.  I hear it gets better each day--you will crave sweets and carbs less and less.  I don't know how I will feel each day, but I feel great already so it can only get better! New squishies are doing great.  They are becoming softer and more a part of me each day.  My arms and pecs still get sore if I use them too much, but each day the pain is less and less and I feel more like myself.  Going to follow-up on Friday and I will find out how big of an implant he put in. I guess my situation is different from many because I had silicone implants since 2009.  I am used to them, so I feel like I have them back in again, except that I can feel them more now since I have no breast tissue.  Who knew my boob job would better prepare me for breast cancer?  How ironic. Health and happiness to all. Oh, taking Viva my puppy to an indoor dog park today! I am excited!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2013 04:06PM kona14 wrote: melmcbee--Chemo stopped my periods and I haven't had another one yet.  I get hot flashes during the day and some nights I get really bad night sweats.  Been on Tamox for almost a month and had little side effects.  Had leg cramping, but I don't know if it is the tamox or from the treadmill.  My MO said periods may or may not return, so it's anybody's guess if you go into permanent menopause or not.  I know radiation is not easy and I wish you the best of health as you finish your courses.  I get my squishies on Tuesday, Feb. 4.  I am nervous about more surgery, pain, and pain meds, but am looking forward to softer boobs that actually move!  My biggest fear is if they will look good and not too small or flat.  I guess if I made it this far, I'll take what I can get.  A nice result would be awesome though! Beckers--you are very strong!  A 62 marriage is beautiful and my prayers go out to you and your mom.  I bet she misses your dad greatly.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2012 12:20PM kona14 wrote: Beckers--I, too, am a huge puppy/dog lover.  Maybe this will bring a smile to your face:  Viva (my new pup) must have embodied the spirit of my female shepherd (Kona) who I lost.  Kona used to give me hugs all the time by snuggling her head in my lap or chest.  My new pup Viva gives hugs by snuggling her head directly into my lap if I sit on the floor with her.  She also gives kisses like Kona used to.  My male shepherd I lost, Riptide, used to turn his head left to right as I spoke to him.  Viva now turns her head when I speak to her.  Call me crazy, but those dog lovers out there know where I am coming from.  It really seems like both of the dogs I have lost have some of their spirit in Viva.  She truly is a gift from above! :)
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2012 07:13AM kona14 wrote: Melmcbee--My 5th round made me extremely sick.  The night of my neulasta shot, I ran a 100.5 fever.  My acid reflux was horrible and I felt like a truck hit me for about 8 days.  I think the chemos get progressively harder as your body tries to recoup.  I am dreading #6, but I know that I have to do it.  So sorry to hear you are feeling horrible!  Hang in there.  You only have one more to go also!  Yeah!  Just know that I am with you and know exactly (almost) how you feel. Granellie--how cool to see your pics.  I completely can see how you feel through your drawings.  This was very inspiring to me.  If I could draw as well, I would draw a black cloud with me starting to walk out of it.  After I lost my dogs, I feel like I have been in the worst black cloud of desolation.  However, I have to walk on and live.  Very cool pics!  Thanks for sharing! To all sick gals--I know that it feels so unfair to have to fight a cold or the flu PLUS go through this damn BC treatment.  The harder life tries to knock us down, the harder we have to fight to remain standing.  Keep the fluids going and I hope and pray all of you will feel better soon. Have a great weekend everyone.  On a brighter side, my DH took me to a German Shepherd breeder and trainer.  We put down a deposit on a pup.  The litter is due Dec. 16, so I should have my new little boy or girl around the middle of February.  I have mixed emotions, but I am such a nurturer that I have to have a dog to love by my side!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2013 07:40AM kona14 wrote: Meg--if you're still reading these posts, I wish you nothing but healing and strength.  I hope you find your deepest inner strength to guide you to  happiness.  So sorry for the way you feel and know that your acute insights will be missed. Waterpolomom--I am going to have my exchange surgery in February.  Just wondering if you are happy with your exchange and if you have any advice.  I am going to ask for projection, cleavage, and symmetry. My right expander filled flatter than my left which has nice projection.   I am a full "c" now and pretty happy.  I used to be a double "D", so the smaller foobies are nice!  Can't wait for squishing instead of rocks that barely move! Anyone have trouble getting through airport security with their expanders?  My PS said I wouldn't have any issues and no letter is necessary.  True? My irregular spotting has stopped from the tamoxifen.  Doing well and looking forward to Vegas soon.  Hope all of you are doing well and having a healthy new year.  I find looking forward to events really helps me get by day to day.

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2013 04:28AM kona14 wrote: Waterpolomom--wow!  I have chemo brain still!  I see that you get your squishies in February of this year too!  I must of read that you got your squishies in Feb. of last year. Well, we will get our new foobies together in February at least!  Sorry--ignore my question! :)
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2012 11:54AM kona14 wrote: Avatar of my new puppy, Viva!  Her ears are up and she is sooooo adorable!  Happy holidays to everyone.  Stay healthy!  Omeggo--I think our poor DH's are forgotten sometimes.  What a sweetheart you have!  When I was getting my cardiac ablation on Wednesday, my DH went to the gift shop and bought me a German Shepherd ornament.  It made me cry!  I think all of us who have a DH in the wings need to give them extra love and attention this holiday season.  Good luck with your chemo; sounds like you are doing a great job recording all of your se's.  I think many women are too afraid to call third MO's with concerns over se's, but that is why they are there.  Never hesitate to call if you have any concerns.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2012 04:22AM kona14 wrote: Beckers--hope you are feeling well after surgery.  I hope you get excellent results. waterpolomom--sorry to hear about the cellulitis. Mu son actually had it twice.  Guess you are more prone to get it after the first time, so be CAREFUL!  It is nothing to mess around with. My PS wouldn't fill me during chemo b/c of the risk of infection, so I have had the same size foobies since August.  I am so excited to start getting filled again on Jan. 7.  Hopefully I will find out my exchange date also.  First day of tamoxifen today.  Doc said to start Jan. 1, but heck with that.  Let's get the show on the road.  I am thinking about tamoxifen just like a vitamin.  Something good for my body.  Hopefully this mental imaging will lessen any side effects!?!? Happy New Year!  May 2013 bring lots of luck and health to all of you!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2013 11:03AM kona14 wrote: LOVE Jim Carey in the happy dance!  TOO funny, Tazzy!  Well, off all pain medication, even Tylenol.  I have some big squishies and so far so good.  They are not perfectly the exact same size, but I'll take them.  I used to be a double D and I think I still am.  Hope they soften a bit.  While resting I watched some documentaries on Netflix about juicing and its extrodinary benefits and cancer fighting abilities.  My DH and I are going to get a juicer and try to drink a "green monster" at least once a day.  Anyone else out there juice and do you believe in it? I feel that having cancer twice is enough.  Maybe time to boost the immune system to the max!?!

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2013 03:50AM - edited Feb 2, 2013 03:53AM by kona14 Nbnotes--good luck also Tuesday!  And congrats on your great test results!  We can heal together after our surgeries; let us know how you are doing when you can after surgery. Beckers--Viva is doing great!  She just turned 4 months old and makes me laugh several times a day.  She is a big hugger and loves to snuggle with me on the couch!  I dearly miss my two shepherds who passed everyday, but she truly helps the pain when she does her puppy actions! SOOOOOOOOOO precious! Tazzy--I haven't been back to work yet.  I can only imagine how tiring the days must be.  Hang in there and fuel your body well! Hope all of you keep chugging along successfully on this very difficult path to healing.  Talk to all of you after I have foobies!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2012 06:59AM kona14 wrote: It's an absolutely gorgeous day in the Midwest!  I just got done doing Tae Bo.  Something about that Billy Blanks is very inspiring.  I am scared however to do too much arm motions.  Anyone believe that we should take it easy with our arms while exercising, or is it okay to use them?  My expanders are doing great so far and I would hate to mess them up.  I go to the chair for round 5 on Wednesday. It is like a looming gray cloud hanging over my head.  I just keep telling myself TWO more and I am done!  It gets harder and harder to go b/c I know what will lie ahead with SE's.  Good luck to all girls this week!  Enjoy the weather if it is nice by you.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2012 12:20PM kona14 wrote: It's been one week and not one sign of our dogs.  I believe my neighbor who is a taxidermist shot them.  There is no other explanation.  He has shot dogs in the past.  He is an EVIL man.  He denies it, but deep down my husband and I know it had to be him.  I am numb still and can't stop thinking about them, but I have to get myself better.  This is not good for the healing process.  I ordered two canvas pics of my shepherds so that I can always see them in my house.  When you get knocked down this hard, it's hard to get back up, but I have two sons and a hubby counting on me.  Well wishes to everyone and hopefully little or no SE'S. I go for my last chemo the 5th and then for a cardiac ablation for my SVT the 19th.  I will be all patched up except for my new foobies by the new year!  I just hope in time my heart can heal b/c I miss my babies so much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2012 03:00AM kona14 wrote: Hi everyone.  It looks like most of you are doing well--glad to read it.  I was actually supposed to have my last chemo Dec. 5, but the side effects I had from chemo #5 on Nov. 14 were pretty bad.  I had shortness of breath and my acid reflux got pretty intense.  The neulasta shot was causing me to have a fever and I really was down for the count for 6 days after.  My onc told me that new studies are showing 4 rounds of TC are just as effective as 6 rounds and that she believes giving me my last round would do more harm than good.  So, I am post-chemo and feeling stronger and stronger everyday.  I start tamoxifen on Jan. 1. No rads for me b/c already had 27 rads 22 yrs. ago for Hodgkin's disease.  I cannot have any more radiation to the chest area.  All is well except this morning I am having my cardio abaltion being done for my SVT.  I am nervous, but my doc is well-trained and one of the best.  Hopefully he can fix my SVT and I won't have to worry about getting an attack on the plane to Vegas in Jan.! My avatar is of my baby Riptide who passed.  I miss him and my female Shepherd Kona very very very much!  We did get a new puppy from a breeder and she is sooo darn cute!  We named her Viva (Spanish for to live).  She too is a shepherd and full of energy.  I lost 8 pounds since stopping chemo and getting her!  Puppies sure make you get up and go!  A diet plan I did not expect! Stay well and positive everyone.  I too really appreciate everyone on this forum!

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2012 03:22PM kona14 wrote: Bed, Bath and Beyond sells a great wedge pillow that really helps your back when you're slowly lowering yourself down into bed.  I am 2 1/2 weeks post op and although I am not in pain, I feel like I have a really tight wrap around my chest.  I often get stiff during the night, so getting up and walking around a bit sure does help.  I have my first fill a week from tomorrow and am a little worried about the possible pain.  Does anyone suggest to take a pain pill before your first fill?  Also, does anyone still have feeling?  I have a lot of feeling on my upper "breasts" but not the lower.  Hmmm.
